intro: Medica littoralis, commonly known as the coastal medicine plant, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions. It is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant thrives in saline and sandy soils, making it well adapted to coastal environments. Its leaves contain compounds that have been traditionally used in herbal medicine. Medica littoralis plays a vital role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion along shorelines.
